intro: Bothriocline pauciseta, commonly known as the narrow-leaved daisy, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and yellow. The plant has narrow, linear leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. It is native to southern Africa and thrives in well-drained soils in full sun. Bothriocline pauciseta is often used in rock gardens and as a decorative plant due to its compact growth habit and attractive blooms.
